section.p: The resistance of a metal block depends on the temperature among other things. In the following figure, you see the resistance at some temperatures.

ol.li: Imagine a linear relationship and determine the equation where the resistance is a function from the temperature.
Predict the resistance at a temperature of 400 oC

section.title: Answer
section.codeblock: Resistance = 0.0786*Temp + 21.214 At a temperature of 400oC the predicted resistance is 52.6 Ohm.

section.title: Solution
section.p: The independent variable (x) is the temperature and the dependent variable (y) is the resistance. Determine the slope of the line with the function SLOPE() and the interception with the y-axis with the function INTERCEPT().
Formula for resistance at 400 oC is = 0.0786*400 + 21.214
